titlestmt.titleproper: Upton Sinclair Miscellaneous Materials VI: Book Reviews by Sinclair,1904-1954 PS3537.I85 (InU-Li-VAE1863)

change.item: Encoded finding aid created by Mary McSparran.

did.unittitle: Upton Sinclair Miscellaneous Materials VI: Book Reviews by Sinclair
did.abstract: This collection consists of book reviews written by Upton Sinclair and published in various magazines, newspapers, and journals.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Upton Sinclair, 1878-1968, author, is best-known for his classic muck-raking novel The Jungle, which exposed labor and sanitary conditions in the U.S. meatpacking industry.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged chronologically by publication date.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of book reviews written by Upton Sinclair and published in various magazines, newspapers, and journals. Items in this collection are those that are less than 3 pages long; lengthier materials from the Sinclair library have been individually cataloged. "Gottesman" numbers refer to entries in Upton Sinclair: An Annotated Checklist, by Ronald Gottesman.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: See Sinclair mss., Sinclair mss. II, Sinclair mss. III, Sinclair mss. IV, Sinclair mss. V, Sinclair mss. VI, Sinclair mss. VII, also located at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Upton Sinclair Miscellaneous Materials VI: Book Reviews by Sinclair, Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

did.unittitle: The case of Jerome Davis. (In Unity. Chicago. v. 98, no. 11, Feb. 1, 1937. p. 217) Comment of Jerome Davis' latest book Capitalism and culture. Gottesman A1761.
Desmond's "Democracy" / reviewed by Upton Sinclair. (In Reprint of the regular review of new books from The Chicago daily news. July 2, 1919) Gottesman A629[?].

If writers had a magic wand / Upton Sinclair. (In The Saturday review of literature. v. 30, no. 2, Jan. 11, 1947. p. 11–12 : ill., ports.) Review of I wish I'd written that, ed. Eugene J. Woods. Gottesman A2047.
Manassas / by Upton Sinclair. (In The independent : a weekly magazine. v. 57, no. 2920, Nov. 17, 1904. p. 1149–1150) Sinclair reviews his own book, Manassas, at the request of the editor.

Pleasure and profit in self portrait of U.S. / by Upton Sinclair. (In The Los Angeles daily news. Dec. 2, 1950. p. 24, 27) Review of An anthology of American autobiography, ed. by Irving Stone. Gottesman A2081.

"The profits of religion" / reviewed by Upton Sinclair. Chicago, 1919. 1 leaf ; 27 x 30 cm. "Reprinted from the Wednesday Book Page of the Chicago Daily News, Wednesday, February 12, 1919." Gottesman A598.
[Review of The prodigal parents, by Sinclair Lewis] (In Common sense. Mar. 1938. p. 22–23 : ill.) Gottesman A1877.
Since leaving home. (In Pearson's magazine. Jan. 1924. p. 55–56) A review of: Since leaving home / by Albert Wehde. Chicago : Tremonia Pub. Co., [1923] Gottesman A962.
Socialism, red or white. (In The nation. v. 133, no. 3453, Sept. 9, 1931. p. 261–262) A review of Bolshevism at a deadlock, by Karl Kautsky. Gottesman A1343.

Some new books / by Upton Sinclair. (From Wilshire's magazine. Feb. 1910. p. 16) Sinclair's opinions of Ann Veronica, by H. G. Wells ; A certain rich man, by W. A. White ; Toil of men, by I. Querido. Gottesman A365.

"The story of a proletarian life" : a review / by Upton Sinclair. (In The open forum. Los Angeles. v. 3, no. 27, July 3, 1926. p. 3) Review of a book by Bartolomeo Vanzetti. This number of The open forum also includes two letters by Sinclair: More letter to a capitalist; and, Government and business. Gottesman A1100.

Two notable books / reviewed by Upton Sinclair. (In Wilshire's magazine. v. 14, no. 9, Sept. 1910. p. 15 : port.) The books reviewed are: Twentieth Century socialism, by Edmond Kelly; and, Life of Karl Marx, by John Spargo. Gottesman A381 note.

[Two notable books / reviewed by Upton Sinclair] (From The new age. Sept. 8, 1910. p. 444–445) The books reviewed are: Twentieth Century socialism, by Edmond Kelly; and, Life of Karl Marx, by John Spargo. Gottesman A381.
Über Emile Zola / von Upton Sinclair. (In Neues Österrreich. Vienna. Jänner 1954. p.12.) Book review. Gottesman A2145.

Upton Sinclair's page. (In Appeal to reason. Girard, Kan. no. 1374, Apr. 1, 1922. p. 2) Contains the following articles by Sinclair: On being Charlie Chaplin ; A story from Arden ; Two unusual books. Gottesman A840.

The voice is the voice of evil : from France comes this timely novel of men who adopted the devil's ways ... / by Upton Sinclair. (From the New York Times books review. Section 7. Mar. 18, 1951. p. 1, 20 : port.) A review of The burned bramble, by Manes Sperber. New York, 1951. Gottesman A2087.
What Columbus started : Richard Armour finds history hilarious. (In Pasadena star–news. May 17, 1953. p. 27 : ill., port.) A review of Armour's It all started with Columbus. Gottesman A2128.
